title: where Time grows
content:
And the winter reminded me
Trees are old dreams
seeds that squirrels 
hoped would be food
some springs ago

And the winter reminded me
Trees are new desires
if you just shut
your eyes
real tight
you’ll see
the
leaves dancing
on the back of your eyelids

And the Trees reminded me
winter tends to time
gently
quietly
slowly
like snow
settling
into
roots

title: sol
content:
This is the story of a boy chasing his shadow
hoping he’ll get closer to the Sun
ooking at the signs having forgotten the
Source

He stands and
his shadow stands taller
He runs to close the distance
between the two of them
Too far for him
his shadow slipping away

And so he waits until
his shadow stretches surely
past the horizon
seeing where it goes
until he can’t see at all

I am lost
he thinks

Suddenly
beams of
Good and Beautiful
like Truth written across the sky

And he wonders
how he ever mistook
his shadow for the Sun
at all

title: conversations i overheard today
content:
• two boys across from each other at
breakfast said good morning
then ate pancakes in content silence

• some geese squabbled on a bench
about politics or their lack of bread
but probably about politics
it’s always politics

• an old woman on the phone with her
even older mother jokes
she misses her
but misses her cooking more
she probably says that every time
they call

• four friends spoke about school projects
and their outfits and how the longing
for monday is worse than the longing
for the weekend and how they love 
growing up
and how they hate growing up and how 
the sun is finally coming out again and 
they never said it but i could only hear
i love you

title: Boyhood
content:
They told him to grow up
so he put down his art
because that’s what men do
and it’s stupid to make believe
because that’s what boys do

So now he drives to work
and turns on the news
But he forgets to buy gas 
or listen to the news

His neck is stiff
like he swallowed
the stock market
with his cereal

And his table is scattered
with insurance bills and mail
and he seems to have misplaced
his keys along with his dreams

But he’s got 14 of his paintings 
strewn across his wall because
he never stopped believing
in love

because that’s what men do 
because that’s what boys do
